postContent:
Welcome to **ngx-mkdumblog**!

An simple and dumb (really dumb!) blog platform, primarily created for the GitHub Pages service.

- First, you won't be able to run this locally because of the CORS settings most browsers have. Maybe IE would let you do it.
- In the *settings.json* file you will find some settings like the data on the 'About' area, blog name and how many posts mkdumblog should load on the home page.
- There's also the default favicon, which you can change.
- Included in [YourUsername.github.io/?page=editor](?page=editor) (magic link, click on it!) is the editor page called mkCanvas, which runs with the *SimpleMDE* markdown editor.
- To publish on GitHub Pages you just need to commit to your .github.io repo the files generated in the */dist* folder after you run **npm install** and then **npm run build** on your console. (There's also pre-compiled versions available on the [ngx-mkdumblog repo](http://github.com/pedroCX486/ngx-mkdumblog).)
- If you use the pre-compiled version, you don't need to (re)build anything. Just modify the *settings.json* and publish it! The pre-compiled version is generated using **npm run build** and compressed using 7-zip.

And I guess that's it! Happy blogging!
